Package org.cvs.application.services

Interface PortfolioService

All Known Implementing Classes:
PortfolioServiceImpl
@Service
public interface PortfolioService
Provides service operations that can be carried out with portfolios.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Yamiko J. Msosa

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Portfolio addPortfolio​(Portfolio portfolio)
    Adds a new Portfolio instance.
    void deletePortfolio​(java.lang.Long portfolioId)
    Marks a given Portfolio instance as deleted in the database.
    Portfolio getActivePortfolio​(java.lang.Long portfolioId)
    Fetches an active Portfolio instance given its name.
    Portfolio getByPortfolioName​(java.lang.String name)
    Fetches an active Portfolio instance given its name.
    java.util.List<Portfolio> getPortfolios()
    Fetches all active Portfolio instances from the database.
    java.util.List<Portfolio> getPortfolios​(java.lang.Long userId)
    Fetches all active Portfolio instances for the specified application user from the database.
    void retirePortfolio​(java.lang.Long portfolioId)
    Marks a given Portfolio instance as retired in the database.
    Portfolio updatePortfolioWithCandidate​(java.lang.Long candidateId, java.lang.Long portfolioId)
    Updates a Portfolio instance with its associated candidate.
    Portfolio updatePortfolioWithUser​(java.lang.Long userId, java.lang.Long portfolioId)
    Updates a Portfolio instance with its associated user.

  • Method Details

    • addPortfolio

      Portfolio addPortfolio​(Portfolio portfolio)
      Adds a new Portfolio instance.
      Parameters:
      portfolio - a portfolio instance to be added
      Returns:
      a newly added portfolio instance

    • updatePortfolioWithUser

      Portfolio updatePortfolioWithUser​(java.lang.Long userId, java.lang.Long portfolioId) throws EntryNotFoundException, EntryNotActiveException
      Updates a Portfolio instance with its associated user.
      Parameters:
      userId - an ID for the user that is to be associated with this portfolio
      portfolioId - an ID of the portfolio instance to be associated with the specified user
      Returns:
      a newly associated portfolio instance
      Throws:
      EntryNotFoundException
      EntryNotActiveException

    • updatePortfolioWithCandidate

      Portfolio updatePortfolioWithCandidate​(java.lang.Long candidateId, java.lang.Long portfolioId) throws EntryNotFoundException, EntryNotActiveException
      Updates a Portfolio instance with its associated candidate.
      Parameters:
      candidateId - an ID for the candidate that is to be associated with this portfolio
      portfolioId - an ID of the portfolio instance to be associated with the specified candidate
      Returns:
      a newly associated portfolio instance
      Throws:
      EntryNotFoundException
      EntryNotActiveException

    • getByPortfolioName

      Portfolio getByPortfolioName​(java.lang.String name) throws EntryNotFoundException
      Fetches an active Portfolio instance given its name.
      Parameters:
      name - a name to be used as the search key
      Returns:
      an active portfolio instance that matches the search criteria
      Throws:
      EntryNotFoundException

    • getActivePortfolio

      Portfolio getActivePortfolio​(java.lang.Long portfolioId) throws EntryNotFoundException, EntryNotActiveException
      Fetches an active Portfolio instance given its name.
      Parameters:
      portfolioId - ID to be used as the search key
      Returns:
      an active portfolio instance that matches the search criteria
      Throws:
      EntryNotFoundException
      EntryNotActiveException

    • deletePortfolio

      void deletePortfolio​(java.lang.Long portfolioId) throws EntryNotFoundException
      Marks a given Portfolio instance as deleted in the database.
      Parameters:
      portfolioId - ID to be used as a key field during search
      Throws:
      EntryNotFoundException

    • retirePortfolio

      void retirePortfolio​(java.lang.Long portfolioId) throws EntryNotFoundException
      Marks a given Portfolio instance as retired in the database.
      Parameters:
      portfolioId - ID to be used as a key field during search
      Throws:
      EntryNotFoundException

    • getPortfolios

      java.util.List<Portfolio> getPortfolios()
      Fetches all active Portfolio instances from the database.
      Returns:
      a list of portfolio instances

    • getPortfolios

      java.util.List<Portfolio> getPortfolios​(java.lang.Long userId)
      Fetches all active Portfolio instances for the specified application user from the database.
      Parameters:
      userId - the user ID to filter portfolios for
      Returns:
      a list of portfolio instances
